meta.name: Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse
meta.description: Teen Miles Morales becomes the Spider-Man of his universe and must join with five spider-powered individuals from other dimensions to stop a threat for all realities.

review.name: A Spidey Movie That Works In Multiple Dimensions
review.reviewBody: Visually stunning. Great storyline. Great cast. Amazing soundtrack. Tear jerking cameo. Pop culture post credit scene of the decade. Thank you Marvel and Sony for making a Spidey movie everyone can love.

meta.keywords: multiverse,teenage superhero,wisecrack humor,posthumous cameo,miles morales character

description.value: Spider-Man crosses parallel dimensions and teams up with the Spider-Men of those dimensions to stop a threat to all reality.

plotText.plainText: Teen Miles Morales becomes the Spider-Man of his universe and must join with five spider-powered individuals from other dimensions to stop a threat for all realities.

text.plaidHtml: If you hit pause anytime a train goes by, because all the animators wanted to animate Stan Lee, he's in almost every single train.

Miles is nearly a foot shorter than Peter Parker, yet when Miles takes one of Peter's old costumes to use as his own, it fits him perfectly. This was done intentionally by the filmmakers, meant to be an illustration of Miles' earlier conversation with Stan, the comic shop owner ("It always fits. Eventually."). Miles has grown more confident, more skillful, and more comfortable with his new powers and is finally ready to take on the role of Spider-Man; thus the costume (like the role itself) finally "fits".

lines.text: That person who helps others simply because it should or must be done, and because it is the right thing to do, is indeed without a doubt, a real superhero.

text.plaidHtml:
There is a dedication in the closing credits to "Spider-Man" creators Stan Lee and Steve Ditko, who passed away in 2018.

It is an image of Stan Lee's glasses with a quote: "That person who helps others simply because it should or must be done, and because it is the right thing to do, is indeed without a doubt, a real superhero. - Stan Lee" "Thank you Stan Lee & Steve Ditko for telling us we're not the only ones."

The Blu-Ray for the film features an "Alternate Universe Cut," featuring unseen, unfinished and unused footage, which shows alternate scenarios for certain scenes and extends the runtime to 2h 23m instead of the original 1h 57m.
